name: factorization
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the dividing of a number into factors (= whole numbers that are produced when you divide a larger number by another whole number): The factorization of 6 produces 1 and 6, and 2 and 3, because either of those pairs multiplied together equal 6. The factorisation of 48 yields 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, and 48. The question asks students to perform a factorization of 160.
More examplesFewer examplesFactorisation is taught early on in the mathematics syllabus.Matrix factorizations have been considered as tools for data analysis here.
